question.content: I've heard a friend of mine in Rivermist recently visited Stonebrook, and she mentioned the journey felt quite extensive. I'm curious, do you happen to have an idea about the actual distance between the two places?

Covering the distance from Rivermist to Stonebrook sure seems like a long trip. I'm a bit worried if my vehicle can endure the journey with the current fuel level. I'm not entirely sure how far my car can travel on the remaining fuel. What do you think?
Thanks a lot! Before I embark on this journey, it makes sense to ensure I won't be left stranded due to an empty tank. Just add to the tank fully.
Great! My tank are full now.
With my tank now full, let's embark on this journey. I'd appreciate it if you could start the car for me.
By the way, as I travel, there are some updates I need to communicate to my friend Michael. Would you be able to send message 'I am on my way.'?
Lastly, while I'm on the road, I want to make sure I have informed everyone that should be aware. Could you display what messages I've send thus far?

function.name: add_contact
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: Add a contact to the workspace. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

user_name.description: User name of contact to be added.

added_status.description: True if the contact was added successfully, False otherwise.

user_id.description: User ID of the added contact.

message.description: A message describing the result of the addition attempt.

function.name: delete_message
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: Delete the latest message sent to a receiver. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

receiver_id.description: User ID of the user to send the message to.

deleted_status.description: True if the message was deleted successfully, False otherwise.

receiver_id.description: ID of the receiver of the deleted message.

message.description: A message describing the result of the deletion attempt.

function.name: get_message_stats
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: Get statistics about messages for the current user. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

received_count.description: Number of messages received by the current user.

total_contacts.description: Total number of contacts the user has interacted with.

function.name: get_user_id
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: Get user ID from user name. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

function.name: list_users
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: List all users in the workspace. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

user_list.description: List of all users in the workspace.

function.name: message_get_login_status
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: Get the login status of the current user. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

login_status.description: True if the current user is logged in, False otherwise.

function.name: message_login
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: Log in a user with the given user ID to messeage application. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

user_id.description: User ID of the user to log in.

login_status.description: True if login was successful, False otherwise.

message.description: A message describing the result of the login attempt.

function.name: search_messages
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: Search for messages containing a specific keyword. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

keyword.description: The keyword to search for in messages.

results.description: List of dictionaries containing matching messages.

receiver_id.description: User ID of the receiver of the message.

function.name: send_message
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: Send a message to a user. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

receiver_id.description: User ID of the user to send the message to.

sent_status.description: True if the message was sent successfully, False otherwise.

message.description: A message describing the result of the send attempt.

function.name: view_messages_sent
function.description: This tool belongs to the Message API, which is used to manage user interactions in a workspace. Tool description: View all historical messages sent by the current user. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

messages.description: Dictionary of messages grouped by receiver An example of the messages dictionary is {"USR001":["Hello"],"USR002":["World"]}.

function.name: activateParkingBrake
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Activates the parking brake of the vehicle. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

_parkingBrakeForce.description: The force applied to the brake in Newtons.

function.name: adjustClimateControl
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Adjusts the climate control of the vehicle. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

temperature.description: The temperature to set in degree. Default to be celsius.

fanSpeed.description: The fan speed to set from 0 to 100. Default is 50.

currentTemperature.description: The current temperature set in degree Celsius.

function.name: check_tire_pressure
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Checks the tire pressure of the vehicle. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

tirePressure.description: The tire pressure of the vehicle.

frontLeftTirePressure.description: The pressure of the front left tire in psi.

frontRightTirePressure.description: The pressure of the front right tire in psi.

rearLeftTirePressure.description: The pressure of the rear left tire in psi.

rearRightTirePressure.description: The pressure of the rear right tire in psi.

healthy_tire_pressure.description: True if the tire pressure is healthy, False otherwise.

function.name: displayCarStatus
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Displays the status of the vehicle based on the provided display option. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

status.description: The status of the vehicle based on the option.

fuelLevel.description: [Optional] The fuel level of the vehicle in gallons.

batteryVoltage.description: [Optional] The battery voltage of the vehicle in volts.

driver.description: The status of the driver door. [Enum]: ["locked", "unlocked"]

passenger.description: The status of the passenger door. [Enum]: ["locked", "unlocked"]

rear_left.description: The status of the rear left door. [Enum]: ["locked", "unlocked"]

rear_right.description: The status of the rear right door. [Enum]: ["locked", "unlocked"]

currentACTemperature.description: [Optional] The current temperature set in degree Celsius.

fanSpeed.description: [Optional] The fan speed set from 0 to 100.

parkingBrakeForce.description: [Optional] The force applied to the brake in Newtons.

brakePedalStatus.description: [Optional] The status of the brake pedal. [Enum]: ["pressed", "released"]

brakePedalForce.description: [Optional] The force applied to the brake pedal in Newtons.

function.name: display_log
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Displays the log messages. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

messages.description: The list of messages to display.

function.name: estimate_distance
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Estimates the distance between two cities. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

cityA.description: The zipcode of the first city.

cityB.description: The zipcode of the second city.

distance.description: The distance between the two cities in km.

intermediaryCities.description: [Optional] The list of intermediary cities between the two cities.

function.name: estimate_drive_feasibility_by_mileage
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Estimates the milage of the vehicle given the distance needed to drive. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

distance.description: The distance to travel in miles.

canDrive.description: True if the vehicle can drive the distance, False otherwise.

function.name: fillFuelTank
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Fills the fuel tank of the vehicle. The fuel tank can hold up to 50 gallons. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

fuelAmount.description: The amount of fuel to fill in gallons; this is the additional fuel to add to the tank.

fuelLevel.description: The fuel level of the vehicle in gallons.

function.name: find_nearest_tire_shop
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Finds the nearest tire shop. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

shopLocation.description: The location of the nearest tire shop.

function.name: gallon_to_liter
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Converts the gallon to liter. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

gallon.description: The amount of gallon to convert.

function.name: get_current_speed
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Gets the current speed of the vehicle. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

currentSpeed.description: The current speed of the vehicle in km/h.

function.name: get_outside_temperature_from_google
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Gets the outside temperature. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

outsideTemperature.description: The outside temperature in degree Celsius.

function.name: get_outside_temperature_from_weather_com
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Gets the outside temperature. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

outsideTemperature.description: The outside temperature in degree Celsius.

function.name: get_zipcode_based_on_city
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Gets the zipcode based on the city. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

function.name: liter_to_gallon
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Converts the liter to gallon. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

liter.description: The amount of liter to convert.

function.name: lockDoors
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Locks the doors of the vehicle. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

unlock.description: True if the doors are to be unlocked, False otherwise.

door.description: The list of doors to lock or unlock. [Enum]: ["driver", "passenger", "rear_left", "rear_right"]

remainingUnlockedDoors.description: The number of remaining unlocked doors.

function.name: pressBrakePedal
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Presses the brake pedal based on pedal position. The brake pedal will be kept pressed until released. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

pedalPosition.description: Position of the brake pedal, between 0 (not pressed) and 1 (fully pressed).

brakePedalStatus.description: The status of the brake pedal. [Enum]: ["pressed", "released"]

brakePedalForce.description: The force applied to the brake pedal in Newtons.

function.name: releaseBrakePedal
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Releases the brake pedal of the vehicle. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

brakePedalStatus.description: The status of the brake pedal. [Enum]: ["pressed", "released"]

brakePedalForce.description: The force applied to the brake pedal in Newtons.

function.name: setCruiseControl
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Sets the cruise control of the vehicle. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

speed.description: The speed to set in m/h. The speed should be between 0 and 120 and a multiple of 5.

activate.description: True to activate the cruise control, False to deactivate.

distanceToNextVehicle.description: The distance to the next vehicle in meters.

cruiseStatus.description: The status of the cruise control. [Enum]: ["active", "inactive"]

currentSpeed.description: The current speed of the vehicle in km/h.

distanceToNextVehicle.description: The distance to the next vehicle in meters.

function.name: setHeadlights
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Sets the headlights of the vehicle. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

function.name: set_navigation
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Navigates to the destination. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

destination.description: The destination to navigate in the format of street, city, state.

function.name: startEngine
function.description: This tool belongs to the vehicle control system, which allows users to control various aspects of the car such as engine, doors, climate control, lights, and more. Tool description: Starts the engine of the vehicle. Note that the provided function is in Python 3 syntax.

ignitionMode.description: The ignition mode of the vehicle. [Enum]: ["START", "STOP"]

fuelLevel.description: The fuel level of the vehicle in gallons.

batteryVoltage.description: The battery voltage of the vehicle in volts.

begin_of_turn_query.content: I've heard a friend of mine in Rivermist recently visited Stonebrook, and she mentioned the journey felt quite extensive. I'm curious, do you happen to have an idea about the actual distance between the two places?

step_2.content: The distance between Rivermist and Stonebrook is approximately **750 miles**. That's indeed quite an extensive journey! Your friend was right - that's a substantial distance that would definitely feel like a long trip.

begin_of_turn_query.content: Covering the distance from Rivermist to Stonebrook sure seems like a long trip. I'm a bit worried if my vehicle can endure the journey with the current fuel level. I'm not entirely sure how far my car can travel on the remaining fuel. What do you think?

step_2.content:
Based on the analysis, your vehicle **cannot** make the 750-mile trip with the current fuel level of 5 gallons. The system indicates that your current fuel is insufficient for this distance.

To help you plan better, you'll need to refuel before attempting this journey. The fuel tank can hold up to 50 gallons, so you have plenty of capacity to add fuel for this trip. I'd recommend filling up your tank before heading out on such a long drive to ensure you can complete the journey safely without running out of fuel.
